CODIF_DATA.TD_DOCUMENT_TYPE: Prior information notice without call for competition
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 01C21

ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: NHS Hastings and Rother Clinical Commissioning Group

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: NHS Hastings and Rother Clinical Commissioning Group

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY_ADDITIONAL.OFFICIALNAME: NHS Eastbourne Hailsham and Seaford Clinical Commissioning Group
NHS High Weald Lewes Havens Clinical Commissioning Group

TITLE.P: Nursing Care Placements (Including Continuing Healthcare Services) Ref 18.455 2nd RFI

SHORT_DESCR.P: East Sussex Clinical Commissioning Groups are reviewing the way they commission services for those individuals who are eligible for fully funded NHS Continuing Healthcare.

The views of current and future providers are sought to help them to develop services that achieve excellent outcomes for patients and at the same time deliver innovative, efficient and sustainable services for both providers and commissioners. Views are particularly sought relating to quality standards, finances, and performance monitoring.

The commissioners would like to thank all providers that have responded to the Request For Information (RFI) so far. In light of the Christmas period we would like to extend the deadline for responses to midday on Friday 25.1.2019 [providers that have already replied to the RFI do not need to respond again, but can still request a telephone appointment, (see below)].

MAIN_SITE.P: Service provided to patients of the population of East Sussex.

SHORT_DESCR.P: East Sussex Clinical Commissioning Groups are reviewing the way they commission services for those individuals who are eligible for fully funded NHS Continuing Healthcare.

The views of current and future providers are sought to help them to develop services that achieve excellent outcomes for patients and at the same time deliver innovative, efficient and sustainable services for both providers and commissioners. Views are particularly sought relating to quality standards, finances, and performance monitoring.

The commissioners would like to thank all providers that have responded to the Request For Information (RFI) so far. In light of the Christmas period we would like to extend the deadline for responses to midday on Friday 25.1.2019 [providers that have already replied to the RFI do not need to respond again, but can still request a telephone appointment, (see below)].

In order to assist providers with understanding and responding to this RFI, the commissioners are making themselves available for a telephone conversation to take place during the week commencing 14.1.2019. If you wish to take up the offer of a phone conversation to discuss this further you can schedule a telephone conversation with the commissioners by contacting 01323 466120 (option 1) and ask for a CHC reprocurement telephone appointment.

This market engagement is being conducted on behalf of the East Sussex Clinical Commissioning Groups comprising: NHS High Weald Lewes Havens CCG, NHS Eastbourne Hailsham and Seaford CCG, and NHS Hastings and Rother CCG.
The 3 CCGs are considering their approach to commissioning the services and wish to engage with potential providers by means of the attached Request for Information (RFI) document.

As CCG commissioners we understand that your views are key to this process and would appreciate if you could respond to a set of questions (please click on the link below). Whilst this process is not the commencement of procurement, your responses will help shape the future of the service.
The deadline for receipt of your completed RFI return by email to aelliott1@nhs.net is 12:00 midday on 25.1.2019.
The estimated value for the envisaged 2 year initial contract period is 50 000 000 GBP.

This RFI process is designed to help the commissioner form a view of the best way to commission the service and is not the beginning of a tender exercise. A further tender advertisement will be issued at the appropriate time as/if required. The attached RFI questionnaire and covering letter has been sent directly to existing providers. The services to which this RFI relates fall within chapter 3, section 7, Particular Procurement Regimes to the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 and part H of the Annex V to the Public Contracts Directive (also known as “light touch regime” formerly part B services). The publication of the above advertisement shall not be taken to mean that the contracting authority intends to hold itself bound by any of the regulations, save those applicable to chapter 3, section 7, Particular Procurement Regimes.
